macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Rises 0.5% to 49,501 While Nasdaq Slides 1.5% on Tech Weakness
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed up 0.5% or 260.31 points at 49,501.30 with 23 of 30 components positive, but Nasdaq Composite fell 1.5% to 22,904.58 amid poor performance by AI semiconductor stocks; S&P 500 dipped 0.5% to 6,882.72.

items.title: Sector Shifts: Energy and Materials Surge as Tech Sectors Tumble
items.summary: Energy Select Sector SPDR (XLE) advanced 3.2%, Materials (XLB) 2.1%, while Technology (XLK) dropped 2.2%, Communication (XLC) 1.6%, and Health Care (XLV) 1%; VIX rose 3.6% to 18.64 with higher trading volume.

items.title: Momentum Stocks Hit Worst Day in Six Years Amid Tech Rout
items.summary: Goldman Sachs' high beta momentum basket, including Enphase Energy, SanDisk, Lumentum, and Western Digital, suffered its worst session since 2020 due to underperformance in cyclical high-flying tech themes like memory and rare earth stocks.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Markets Plunge for Third Straight Session
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped 3.5% to test $70,000, its lowest since November 2024, before recovering to $71,340, while XRP crashed over 7% below $1.40 and Ethereum fell to $2,068, its lowest since May 2025. The selloff triggered $775 million in liquidations, linked to expectations of hawkish Fed policy under potential new Chair Kevin Warsh.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Impulse AI Launches No-Code Autonomous Machine Learning Platform
items.summary: Impulse AI announced a fully autonomous machine learning platform that enables teams to build, deploy, and monitor production-grade AI models without coding. The platform's AI agent ranked in the top 2.5% of a Kaggle competition, demonstrating performance matching human ML engineers.

items.title: Harvard Researchers Develop BrainIAC: AI Model for Brain Disease Prediction
items.summary: Researchers from Harvard-affiliated Mass General Brigham developed BrainIAC, an AI foundation model trained on nearly 49,000 brain MRI scans that can estimate brain age, predict dementia risk, detect brain tumor mutations, and predict cancer survival. The model outperformed task-specific AI frameworks and excels with limited training data.

items.title: Researchers Demonstrate AI Can Learn and Execute Algorithms Flawlessly
items.summary: Scientists developed a novel approach using graph neural networks and multi-layer perceptrons that enables AI to learn and execute algorithms like breadth-first search and Bellman-Ford with high probability from minimal training data. The work establishes theoretical foundations for more adaptable machine learning systems.

items.title: Nvidia and Dassault Systèmes Partner on Science-Validated Industry World Models
items.summary: Nvidia and Dassault Systèmes announced a deepened collaboration to build physics-validated digital-twin world models combining Nvidia's AI infrastructure with Dassault's 3D design software. The partnership represents a shift toward grounding industrial AI in scientific principles rather than purely data-driven approaches.

items.title: Lexful Introduces AI-Native IT Documentation Platform for MSPs
items.summary: Lexful launched an AI-native documentation platform designed specifically for managed service providers (MSPs) to automatically create, capture, and maintain IT documentation and operational knowledge. The platform aims to address documentation as a major operational risk and growth inhibitor in the MSP industry.

items.title: Research Shows AI in Classrooms Promotes Critical Thinking Over Answer-Getting
items.summary: New analysis challenges concerns about AI in education, revealing that classroom AI is predominantly used to promote reasoning, analysis, and evaluation rather than simply providing answers.

items.title: Bounteous Launches Claude Code Lab Series with Anthropic
items.summary: Bounteous announced a hands-on workshop series in partnership with Anthropic focused on accelerating responsible AI adoption through training in AI, machine learning, agentic systems, and generative technologies.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Announces First Direct Showcase of 2026 for February 5
items.summary: Nintendo has scheduled its first Direct of the year, a 30-minute Partner Showcase focusing on third-party titles for Switch and Switch 2, airing at 9AM ET / 6AM PT on February 5. Expect potential updates on games like The Duskbloods, Elden Ring, and Resident Evil Requiem.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Confirmed for February 5, 2026
items.summary: A Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase is set for Thursday, February 5 at 2pm GMT, featuring roughly 30 minutes of third-party game announcements for Switch and Switch 2, streamable on YouTube and Nintendo Today! app.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Confirmed for February 5 as Partner Showcase
items.summary: Nintendo's next Direct, a Partner Showcase, is confirmed for February 5, highlighting third-party games soon after the announcement on February 4.

items.title: February 2026 Shaping Up with Major Game Releases
items.summary: February 2026 is poised to be a strong month for game releases across various platforms, offering something for every type of gamer.

items.title: Official Nintendo Direct: Partner Showcase on Feb 5
items.summary: Nintendo's Partner Showcase Direct is scheduled for February 5 at 6am PT, lasting about 30 minutes, and viewable on Nintendo Today! app or YouTube.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Texas Instruments to Acquire Silicon Labs for $7.5 Billion
items.summary: Texas Instruments has agreed to acquire Silicon Labs in an all-cash deal valued at $7.5 billion ($231 per share, a 69% premium), aiming for $450 million in cost savings and enhanced wireless connectivity capabilities.

items.title: Memory Market Enters 2026 Super Cycle Driven by DRAM and Enterprise SSDs
items.summary: The industry is entering a 2026 Super Cycle fueled by strong demand for DRAM and Enterprise SSDs, with persistent shortages, rising prices, and shifts toward high-margin data center technologies like QLC SSDs and PCIe Gen6.
